column2: Wall St. Bears Claw Back Into the Black (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Short-sellers, Wall Street's dwindling\band of ultra-cynics, are seeing green again.

column2: Carlyle Looks Toward Commercial Aerospace (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Private investment firm Carlyle Group,\which has a reputation for making well-timed and occasionally\controversial plays in the defense industry, has quietly placed\its bets on another part of the market.

column2: Oil and Economy Cloud Stocks' Outlook (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Soaring crude prices plus worries\about the economy and the outlook for earnings are expected to\hang over the stock market next week during the depth of the\summer doldrums.

column2: Iraq Halts Oil Exports from Main Southern Pipeline (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Authorities have halted oil export\flows from the main pipeline in southern Iraq after\intelligence showed a rebel militia could strike\infrastructure, an oil official said on Saturday.

column2: Oil prices soar to all-time record, posing new menace to US economy (AFP)
column3: AFP - Tearaway world oil prices, toppling records and straining wallets, present a new economic menace barely three months before the US presidential elections.

column2: Stocks End Up, But Near Year Lows (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Stocks ended slightly higher on Friday\but stayed near lows for the year as oil prices surged past  #36;46\a barrel, offsetting a positive outlook from computer maker\Dell Inc. (DELL.O)

column2: Money Funds Fell in Latest Week (AP)
column3: AP - Assets of the nation's retail money market mutual funds fell by  #36;1.17 billion in the latest week to  #36;849.98 trillion, the Investment Company Institute said Thursday.

column2: Fed minutes show dissent over inflation (USATODAY.com)
column3: USATODAY.com - Retail sales bounced back a bit in July, and new claims for jobless benefits fell last week, the government said Thursday, indicating the economy is improving from a midsummer slump.

column2: Safety Net (Forbes.com)
column3: Forbes.com - After earning a PH.D. in Sociology, Danny Bazil Riley started to work as the general manager at a commercial real estate firm at an annual base salary of  #36;70,000. Soon after, a financial planner stopped by his desk to drop off brochures about insurance benefits available through his employer. But, at 32, "buying insurance was the furthest thing from my mind," says Riley.

column2: Wall St. Bears Claw Back Into the Black
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Short-sellers, Wall Street's dwindling  band of ultra-cynics, are seeing green again.

column2: Oil and Economy Cloud Stocks' Outlook
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Soaring crude prices plus worries  about the economy and the outlook for earnings are expected to  hang over the stock market next week during the depth of the  summer doldrums.

column2: No Need for OPEC to Pump More-Iran Gov
column3: TEHRAN (Reuters) - OPEC can do nothing to douse scorching  oil prices when markets are already oversupplied by 2.8 million  barrels per day (bpd) of crude, Iran's OPEC governor said  Saturday, warning that prices could fall sharply.

column2: Non-OPEC Nations Should Up Output-Purnomo
column3: JAKARTA (Reuters) - Non-OPEC oil exporters should consider  increasing output to cool record crude prices, OPEC President  Purnomo Yusgiantoro said on Sunday.

column2: Google IPO Auction Off to Rocky Start
column3: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK (Reuters) - The auction for Google  Inc.'s highly anticipated initial public offering got off to a  rocky start on Friday after the Web search company sidestepped  a bullet from U.S. securities regulators.

column2: Dollar Falls Broadly on Record Trade Gap
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar tumbled broadly on Friday  after data showing a record U.S. trade deficit in June cast  fresh doubts on the economy's recovery and its ability to draw  foreign capital to fund the growing gap.

column2: Rescuing an Old Saver
column3: If you think you may need to help your elderly relatives with their finances, don't be shy about having the money talk -- soon.

column2: Science, Politics Collide in Election Year (AP)
column3: AP - With more than 4,000 scientists, including 48 Nobel Prize winners, having signed a statement opposing the Bush administration's use of scientific advice, this election year is seeing a new development in the uneasy relationship between science and politics.

column2: Building Dedicated to Columbia Astronauts (AP)
column3: AP - A former dormitory converted to classrooms at the Pensacola Naval Air Station was dedicated Friday to two Columbia astronauts who were among the seven who died in the shuttle disaster Feb. 1, 2003.

column2: Russian Cargo Craft Docks at Space Station (AP)
column3: AP - A Russian cargo ship docked with the international space station Saturday, bringing food, water, fuel and other items to the two-man Russian-American crew, a space official said.

column2: Bangkok's Canals Losing to Urban Sprawl (AP)
column3: AP - Along the banks of the canal, women in rowboats grill fish and sell fresh bananas. Families eat on floating pavilions, rocked gently by waves from passing boats.

column2: T. Rex Had Teen Growth Spurt, Scientists Say (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Tyrannosaurus Rex grew incredibly fast\during a teenaged growth spurt that saw the dinosaur expand its\bulk by six times, but the fearsome beasts "lived fast and died\young," researchers said on Wednesday.

column2: Gene Blocker Turns Monkeys Into Workaholics - Study (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Procrastinating monkeys were turned\into workaholics using a gene treatment to block a key brain\compound, U.S. researchers reported on Wednesday.

column2: Dolphins Too Have Born Socialites (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - Some people are born to be the life and\soul of the party -- and so it seems are some dolphins.

column2: What's in a Name? Well, Matt Is Sexier Than Paul (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - As Shakespeare said, a rose by any other\name would smell as sweet. Right?

column2: UK Scientists Allowed to Clone Human Embryos (Reuters)
column3: Reuters - British scientists said on Wednesday\they had received permission to clone human embryos for medical\research, in what they believe to be the first such license to\be granted in Europe.

column2: Rebranded Liechtenstein Welcomes Fresh Prince
column3: VADUZ, Liechtenstein (Reuters) - The people of  Liechtenstein ushered in a new era Sunday as the tiny Alpine  principality welcomed a new ruler and sought to shed its image  as a haven for money launderers.

column2: France marks the 'other D-Day'
column3: Two days of celebrations to honour the Allied veterans who liberated southern France near a climax.

column2: Phish farewell attracts thousands
column3: "Jam band" Phish play their last gigs together at a special festival in the US which has attracted thousands of fans.

column2: Iraq troops move angers S Koreans
column3: Clashes with riot police erupt as thousands protest in Seoul against plans to send troops to help US-led forces in Iraq.

column2: Bush Surveys Damage in Florida as Toll Is Expected to Mount
column3: Hurricane Charley - one of the most powerful storms in the nation's history - caused at least \$20 billion in damage in Florida alone.

column2: Phelps, Rival Thorpe in 200M-Free Semis
column3: ATHENS, Greece - Michael Phelps took care of qualifying for the Olympic 200-meter freestyle semifinals Sunday, and then found out he had been added to the American team for the evening's 400 freestyle relay final.    Phelps' rivals Ian Thorpe and Pieter van den Hoogenband and teammate Klete Keller were faster than the teenager in the 200 free preliminaries...

column2: Pope Struggles Through Mass at Lourdes
column3: LOURDES, France - A sick man among the sick, Pope John Paul II struggled through Sunday Mass at a French shrine that draws desperate people seeking miracle cures. The 84-year-old pontiff gasped, trembled and asked aides for help during the 2 1/2 hour service in sizzling heat...

column2: Singh, Leonard in Final Pairing at PGA
column3: HAVEN, Wis. - Whistling Straits is suddenly the least of anyone's worries...

column2: Venezuela Voters Turn Out in Huge Numbers
column3: CARACAS, Venezuela - Voters turned out in huge numbers Sunday to decide whether to keep populist President Hugo Chavez in power or oust him and his social revolution that critics say has sidelined the middle class and fueled tensions between rich and poor.    Activists on both sides set off huge firecrackers and played recorded bugle songs to wake voters hours before dawn...

column2: Reservists Say War Makes Them Lose Jobs
column3: WASHINGTON - Increasing numbers of National Guard and Reserve troops who have returned from war in Iraq and Afghanistan are encountering new battles with their civilian employers at home. Jobs were eliminated, benefits reduced and promotions forgotten...

column2: US NBA players become the Nightmare Team after epic loss (AFP)
column3: AFP - Call them the "Nightmare Team".

column2: Report: Roenick Paid for Betting Tips (AP)
column3: AP - Flyers star Jeremy Roenick paid more than  #36;100,000 to a Florida firm that made millions selling betting tips to gamblers, law enforcement officials told The Philadelphia Inquirer.

column2: U.S. Basketball Team Loses to Puerto Rico
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - The United States lost their first  basketball match at the Olympics since 1988 on Sunday when  Puerto Rico gave them a shock 92-73 trouncing.

column2: South Africa Ends Phelps Medal Quest
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - South Africa ruined Michael Phelps's  dream of winning a record eight gold medals at the Athens  Olympics with a stunning victory in the men's 4x100 meters  freestyle final on Sunday.

column2: Iran Snub to Israel Challenges IOC
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - Iran defied the Olympic spirit on Sunday  by refusing to contest a judo bout with an Israeli at the  Athens Games, making no effort to hide the fact it was putting  solidarity with the Palestinians before gold medals.

column2: Romanian Gymnasts Edge Ahead of U.S. Women
column3: ATHENS (Reuters) - Daniela Sofronie displayed all her  athleticism to edge Romania ahead of the United States in the  Olympic women's gymnastics team qualifying Sunday.

column2: Roenick Paid for Betting Tips
column3: Flyers center Jeremy Roenick paid more than \$100,000 to a Florida firm that made millions selling betting tips to gamblers, law enforcement officials told The Philadelphia Inquirer.
